page.lettertext:
fol.309r
Belgia 1591: De
c.
1591 15 Decem
b
To: M
r
Bodly
M
r
Bodley.
Francis Vere./
After o
r
vearie hartie Commendac
o
ns: where as by the negligence of
Thomas Wiate
Commissarie appointed to attend on the Companies
disperced under Yo
r
Charge (S
r
Francis Vere:)
her Ma
t
service
committed to him hathe receaved no smale prejudice, as well in that
he sendethe over no certificat
nor muster roles of the Companies
wherby the strength of the said Companies, might be discerned, and
the Checke leviable for the last halfe yeare ended the xj
th
of
October last defalked, to the end the remander of that w
ch
is
growen due over and a bove the xx
li
monethly payd to them and
theire Companies might be aunswered, w
ch
cannot be done untill
certifying the strengthe of the Companies nowe lately sent into
France
(the most of them having ben under his charge) they are
found (in lieu of one thousand compleat w
th
the dead paies) but 638:
w
ch
(if it had appeared by the timely certificat of the commissarie)
might have ben redressed, where w
th
her Ma
tie
is not a little
displeased. Theise are therefore to requier yo
w
i
m
ediately
uppon the receipte hereof, to command the said wyat to make
his spedie repaier hether unto us, and to bring w
th
him suche ro
ll
es
of Musters, and certificat
for weekly lending
, as he hat
h
e
made sithince the v
th
of Februarie Last, and therof not to
faile as he will aunswere his defalte to the contrarie at his uttermost
ill. Here of we requier yo
w
to have care and to give him spedie
direction as aforesaid, so as he p
r
tend not ignorance of this o
r
commandem
t
.
So fare yo
w
hartely well. From the Co
r
t at
whithale the xv
th
of December
1591.
Yo
r
vearie Loving Frend
William Burghley
Hunnsdon
Cobham
Thomas Heneage
Fortescue
